== Personal life == He is the son of an Iraqi international defender, [[Shakir Ali (footballer)|Shakir Ali]], who played for the national team and [[Talaba SC|Al-Talaba]] club in the 1970s and the 1980s.
== Career == === Club === Shakir was signed by [[Iraqi Premier League]] club [[Talaba SC|Al-Talaba]] in 2005, at the age of 18. Following a subsequent two-year spell with his second club [[Arbil SC]], he earned a move abroad to [[Qatar]]i club [[Al-Khor Sports Club|Al-Khor]].
=== International === Shakir represented the former Iraqi Olympic side that won silver at the [[2006 Asian Games]] at [[Doha]], and he was called into the national B team for the [[2007 King's Cup]] in [[Thailand]]. His debut with the [[Iraq national football team|senior team]] came in January 2008, when he played a defensive role in Iraq's 1-1 friendly draw with Jordan.
